body_html:
@gchanan @ezyang @SsnL I'm not done with the PR yet but here is a diff showing what I'm thinking: syed-ahmed@4f1d285

In summary, Generators will have a struct/state called CPUGenerator/CUDAGenerator. Each of these structs will have PRNG engines (for instance, for CPU you can have std::mt19937 and for CUDA, I'm defining Runtian's philox as at::Philox4_32_10). They will have an API exposed through Context.h that would enable the user to modify the state of the generators and their engines.

@gchanan @ezyang @SsnL I'm not done with the PR yet but here is a diff showing what I'm thinking: https://github.com/syed-ahmed/pytorch/commit/4f1d28540a9e65d1d2b1c3bc82bcb1656750f316

In summary, Generators will have a struct/state called CPUGenerator/CUDAGenerator. Each of these structs will have PRNG engines (for instance, for CPU you can have `std::mt19937` and for CUDA, I'm defining Runtian's philox as `at::Philox4_32_10`). They will have an API exposed through Context.h that would enable the user to modify the state of the generators and their engines.
